isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14618 AND RTLO-16618 SERIES - INSTALL - MAIN DRIVE GEAR ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the I.D. of the main drive gear ( Figure 247).

figure.caption: Figure 247. Install Snap Ring in I.D. of Main Drive Gear

step1.para: Mark the main drive gear for timing purposes. Mark any two adjacent teeth on the drive gear and repeat the procedure for the two adjacent teeth directly opposite the first set marked ( Figure 248). A highly visible color of toolmaker's dye is recommended for making timing marks.

figure.caption: Figure 248. Mark Main Drive Gear For Timing Purposes

step1.para: Mesh the marked tooth of the left countershaft drive gear with two marked teeth on the main drive gear ( Figure 249). Slide the input shaft through the main drive gear (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 249. Mesh Marked Tooth of Left Countershaft Drive Gear With Teeth on Main Drive Gear

step1.para: Install the drive gear spacer ( Figure 250). Install the bearing on the input shaft with the external snap ring to the outside (inset).
Install the drive gear bearing on the input shaft and seat bearing into the case bore with the proper bearing driver ( Figure 251).

figure.caption: Figure 251. Seat Bearing into Case Bore

step1.para: Temporarily install the front bearing cover ( Figure 252).

figure.caption: Figure 252. Temporarily Install Front Bearing Cover

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul to drive the input shaft through the bearing ( Figure 253). Remove the front bearing cover.

figure.caption: Figure 253. Drive Input Shaft Through Bearing

step1.para: Install the bearing retainer snap ring ( Figure 254).

figure.caption: Figure 254. Install Bearing Retainer Snap Ring

step1.para: Install front bearing cover and gasket, making sure to align the oil return hole in the case with the hole in the cover ( Figure 255). Secure the front bearing cover on the case with the six bolts, apply Loctite 242 or equivalent to the bolt threads, and tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m) (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 255. Install Front Bearing Cover and Gasket, and Secure With Bolts
